CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1964, pg. 2 reads: "Launching Health Program - Under the guidance of Bruce Beyers, faculty adviser to the Junior Red Cross at Schenley High School, area high-school students are conducting a program in health education. Shown above is George Bobonich, manager of Kroger's, receiving health education pamphlets from Donna Praither and Terence Michel.  The pamphlets are made available at local business establishments and cover many health problems such as cancer, enlarged heart, tuberculosis, anemia, hearing and many other health problems.  Other health pamphlets will be available at the forthcoming Health-O-Rama, to be held at the Savoy Ballroom, 2009 Centre Ave., Pittsburgh 19, Pa.  Also available will be free health tests for diabetes, anemia, vision, hearing, height and weight, and a chest X-ray for the detection of lung cancer, enlarged heart and tuberculosis.  Health-O-Rama is sponsored by the United Fund's Health Research and Services Foundation, in cooperation with the Allegheny County Medical Society and the Allegheny County Health Department."
TitMainTitle: George Bobonich, receiving health education pamphlets for Health-O-Rama fair from Donna Praither and Terence Michel, with possibly Bruce Beyers in background, posed at register in Kroger's grocery store
